42.a: In those rooms the priests ate the most holy food, and put the most holy things.
42.q: For what did the man say the northern and southern rooms in front of the outer courtyard were used?

42.a: The most holy things of the priests were the food offering, the sin offering, and the guilt offering.
42.q: What were the most holy things of the priests?

42.a: The man said the northern and southern rooms were holy places.
42.q: What kind of place did the man say the northern and southern rooms were?

42.a: The priests had to dress in other clothes before going near the people.
42.q: What did the priests have to do before going near the people?

42.a: Each side was five hundred cubits long
42.q: What was the length of each side; north, south east and west?

42.a: The east gate separated between the holy and the not holy.
42.q: What two things did the east gate separate between?

43.a: The man then brought Ezekiel to the gate that opened to the east.
43.q: To which place did the man then bring Ezekiel?

43.a: Ezekiel saw the glory of the God of Israel come from the east.
43.q: What did Ezekiel see and from what direction did it come?

43.a: The Spirit lifted Ezekiel up and brought him to the inner court.
43.q: How did Ezekiel get to the inner court?

43.a: Yahweh said he would place his throne there and would live in the midst of the people of Israel there forever.
43.q: What did Yahweh say he would do in the inner court?

43.a: The people of Israel would no longer profane Yahweh's holy name by putting the thresholds of their shrines next to Yahweh's.
43.q: In what way would the people of Israel no longer profane Yahweh's holy name?

43.a: Yahweh told Ezekiel to tell the house of Israel about the house he had seen in the vision.
43.q: What did Yahweh tell Ezekiel to do about the house he had seen in the vision?

43.a: Israel would have to be ashamed of their sins in order for Ezekiel to reveal to them the design of the house.
43.q: What would Israel have to do in order for Ezekiel to reveal to them the design of the house?

43.a: Yahweh said the regulation for the house was that it would be most holy.
43.q: What did Yahweh say was the regulation for the house?

43.a: The hearth on the altar would be used for the burnt offerings.
43.q: For what would the hearth on the altar be used?

43.a: There were four horns pointing upward on the hearth.
43.q: What things pointed upward on the hearth?

43.a: Yahweh said a bull from the cattle would be a sin offering for the Levitical priests on the first day.
43.q: What did Yahweh say would be the sin offering for the Levitical priests on the first day?

43.a: The descendants of Zadok would serve as Levitical priests at this altar.
43.q: Whose descendants would serve as the Levitical priests at this altar?

43.a: Placing the blood on the altar would cleanse it and make atonement for it.
43.q: What would placing the blood on the altar do for it?

43.a: Yahweh said a male goat without blemish would be a sin offering for the Levitical priests on the second day.
43.q: What did Yahweh say would be the sin offering for the Levitical priests on the second day?

43.a: The priests would have to prepare an unblemished bull and an unblemished ram as a burnt offering to atone for the altar.
43.q: What would the priests have to do for seven days in order to atone for the altar?

43.a: On the eighth day and onward, Yahweh declared he would accept them.
43.q: On the eighth day and onward, what did Yahweh declare he would do?

44.a: The man brought Ezekiel back to the outer sanctuary gate that faced east.
44.q: To where did the man bring Ezekiel?

44.a: The east gate had been sealed shut, because Yahweh the God of Israel had come through it.
44.q: What had been done to the east gate, and why?

44.a: Ezekiel was told to think about the house of Yahweh's entrance and exits.
44.q: About what was Ezekiel told to think regarding the house of Yahweh?

44.a: The house of Israel had brought foreigners with uncircumcised hearts and flesh to the sanctuary.
44.q: What disgusting actions had the house of Israel done to profane Yahweh's sanctuary?

44.a: The house of Israel allowed foreigners into Yahweh's sanctuary because Israel gave the duty of caring for the sanctuary to them.
44.q: Why did the house of Israel allow foreigners into Yahweh's sanctuary?

44.a: The Levites who had wandered away from Yahweh had performed sacrifices before their idols.
44.q: What had the Levites done who wandered away from Yahweh?

44.a: Yahweh declared that the Levites who wandered away from him would not come near him to act as his priests or to approach any of his holy things, the most holy things.
44.q: What did Yahweh say the Levites who wandered away from him would not be allowed to do?

44.a: Yahweh said he would place them as keepers of the work in the house, for all of its duties and everything that is done in it.
44.q: Where was Yahweh going to place the Levites who wandered away from him?

44.a: The sons of Zadok would come near and stand before Yahweh because they fulfilled the duties of Yahweh's sanctuary when the people of Israel wandered away.
44.q: Why did Yahweh declare that the sons of Zadok would come near to him and would stand before him?

44.a: The priests were to wear linen clothes when they came to the gates of the inner courtyard so that they did not sweat.
44.q: What kind of clothes were the priests to wear when they came to the gates of the inner courtyard, and why?

44.a: The priest was allowed to marry a virgin from the line of the house of Israel, or a widow who was married to a priest.
44.q: Who was the priest allowed to marry?

44.a: The priests would teach the people the difference between the holy and the profane, the unclean from the clean.
44.q: Between what would the priests teach the people the difference?

44.a: The priest stood to judge between the people with Yahweh's decrees, and had to be just.
44.q: What was the priest's role in a dispute between Israelites?

44.a: The priests did not receive any property or inheritance in the land of Israel because Yahweh was their inheritance and property.
44.q: Why did the priests not receive any property or inheritance in the land of Israel?

44.a: The priests were to eat the food offerings.
44.q: In short what were the priest to eat?

44.a: The priests were not to eat any carcass or animal torn by a beast, whether bird or beast.
44.q: What were the priests not to eat?

45.a: The people were to make an offering of a holy part of the land when they cast lots to divide up the land.
45.q: What offering were the people to make to Yahweh when they cast lots to divide up the land?

45.a: The holy part of the land would be a place for the houses and towns of the priests.
45.q: The holy part of the land would be a place for what?

45.a: The area of the city would belong to all the house of Israel.
45.q: To whom would the area of the city belong?

45.a: The land of the princes of Israel would be on both sides of the holy place and the city.
45.q: Whose land would be on both sides of the holy place and the city?

45.a: Yahweh tells the princes of Israel to stop evicting Yahweh's people, and to remove violence and strife.
45.q: What does Yahweh tell the princes of Israel to stop doing?

45.a: Yahweh says the balances, ephahs, and baths must be made accurate.
45.q: What does Yahweh say must be made accurate?

45.a: A tenth of a bath for every ten baths would be the regulation offering of oil.
45.q: How much oil from ten baths would be the regulation offering of oil?

45.a: The people of the land would give their contributions to the prince in Israel.
45.q: To whom would the people of the land give their contributions?

45.a: The prince in Israel would be responsible to furnish animals for the offerings.
45.q: Who would be responsible to furnish animals for the offerings at the festivals of the house of Israel?

45.a: The priests were to offer an unblemished bull as a sin offering on the first day of the first month.
45.q: When were the priests to offer an unblemished bull as a sin offering for the sanctuary?

45.a: On the fourteenth day of the first month there would be a seven day festival of unleavened bread.
45.q: When would there be a seven day festival of unleavened bread?

45.a: On the fifteenth day of the seventh month, sin offerings, burnt offerings, food offerings, and offerings of oil were to be given.
45.q: What offerings were to be given on the fifteenth day of the seventh month?

46.a: Yahweh said the east gate of the inner courtyard would be opened on the Sabbath and on the day of the new moon.
46.q: When did Yahweh say the east gate of the inner courtyard would be opened?

46.a: The prince of Israel would worship at the threshold of the inner gate.
46.q: Where would the prince of Israel worship?

46.a: The prince would offer six unblemished lambs and an unblemished ram.
46.q: What would be the burnt offering of the prince on the Sabbath day?

46.a: Yahweh said the rule was that the prince must leave by the same way he came in to worship.
46.q: What did Yahweh say was the rule about how the prince must leave after he worships?

46.a: Yahweh said the rule was that the people must leave by going out straight ahead from where they came in.
46.q: What did Yahweh say was the rule about how the people must leave after they worship?

46.a: The prince would have to open the east gate for the offering, and then go out and shut the gate after him.
46.q: What would the prince have to do at a festival when he gave a freewill offering?

46.a: Yahweh said an unblemished lamb one year old would be given as a burnt offered every morning.
46.q: What did Yahweh say would be given as a burnt offering every morning?

46.a: The inheritance of the prince would be received by his sons.
46.q: According to Yahweh, who would receive the inheritance of the prince?

46.a: The people's inheritance must not be taken away so they are not scattered from their own property.
46.q: Why did Yahweh say the prince must not take the people's inheritance away?

46.a: The priests were not to bring the offerings out to the outer courtyard and so consecrate the people.
46.q: Why were the priests not to bring the guilt, sin, and grain offerings out to the outer courtyard?

46.a: In the cooking hearths at the corners of the outer courtyard, the temple servants would boil the people's sacrifices.
46.q: What would be done in the cooking hearths at the corners of the outer courtyard?

47.q: Which direction did the temple face in Ezekiel's vision?

47.a: Ezekiel saw water flowing from the gate facing east, on its south side.
47.q: What did Ezekiel see at the gate facing east?

47.a: The water became a river that was too deep to pass without swimming.
47.q: How deep did the water become that Ezekiel saw?

47.a: On both sides of the river, the riverbank had many trees.
47.q: What were on both sides of the river?

47.a: This water flowed to the Salt Sea and would restore it to freshness.
47.q: To where did this water flow, and what did it do there?

47.a: The swamps and marshes would not be made fresh at the Salt Sea.
47.q: What would not be made fresh at the Salt Sea?

47.a: Edible trees would grow on the riverbanks, bearing fruit each month and never withering.
47.q: What kind of trees would grow on the riverbanks, and how would they grow?

47.a: Joseph would receive two portions of land among the tribes of Israel.
47.q: Who would receive two portions of land among the tribes of Israel?

47.a: The northern boundary of the land would reach to the border of Damascus.
47.q: The northern boundary of the land would reach to the border of what city?

47.a: The eastern border of the land would be the Jordan River.
47.q: What would be the eastern border of the land?

47.a: The Brook of Egypt would be part of the southern border of the land.
47.q: What brook would be part of the southern border of the land?

47.a: The western border of the land would be the Great Sea.
47.q: What would be the western border of the land?

47.a: The Israelites were to throw lots to determine the inheritance for each person in the land.
47.q: How were the Israelites to determine the inheritances for each person in the land?

47.a: Foreigners living in the midst of the Israelites were to be treated just like the native born people of Israel.
47.q: Who were to be treated just like the native born people of Israel?

48.a: The tribe of Dan would be given the land on the northern border of Israel.
48.q: Which tribe would be given the land on the northern border of Israel?

48.a: The tribe of Asher would be south of the border of Dan.
48.q: Which tribe would be south of the border of the tribe of Dan?

48.a: The tribe of Naphtali would be south of the border of Asher.
48.q: Which tribe would be south of the border of the tribe of Asher?

48.a: In order, the four tribes south of Naphtali would be Manasseh, Ephraim, Reuben, and Judah.
48.q: In order, which four tribes would be south of the tribe of Naphtali?

48.a: The temple would be in the middle of the land located along the border with Judah.
48.q: What would be in the middle of the land located along the border with Judah?

48.a: The priests of the line of Zadok would live on the land surrounding the sanctuary of Yahweh.
48.q: Who would live on the land surrounding the sanctuary of Yahweh?

48.a: The Levites would live on the land bordering the priests' land.
48.q: Who would live on the land bordering the priests' land?

48.a: The remaining area of the holy offering of land would be used to produce food for those working in the city.
48.q: For what would the remaining area of the holy offering of land be used?

48.a: The land on the eastern and western borders of the holy offering of land would be for the prince.
48.q: For whom would be the land on the eastern and western borders of the holy offering of land?

48.a: The southern boundary of Gad was to extend from Tamar to the waters of Meribah Kadesh, and farther to the brook of Egypt, and then to the Great Sea.
48.q: What was to be the southern boundary of Gad?

48.a: There would be three gates on the north side of the city, with one  being named for Reuben, one for Judah, and one for Levi.
48.q: How many gates were to be on the north side of the city, and what were they to be named for?

48.a: The city's name would be "Yahweh is There".
48.q: What would be the city's name?
